Intro
The characters attempt to summon a devil to interogate them for information. The hook the characters receive a document fragment with the devils true name. The paper may contain the Casters will know that using the devils name they can bind it.
Devils are better to summon than demons. Demons are not bound by the words or contracts, they are fundamentally untrustworthy. Devils, like the fey, are bound to any words or contracts they sign.
The Prelude
Devils are very old, very devious and very cunning. The first thing the GM should do is determine what information the characters are trying to find, then stall the characters till the next session to allow the GM time to think about what the devil might do. What information the devil might know and be willing to trade.
Prelude - The Apothecary
Send the player characters off to the apothecary to buy some ritual spell components (to buy time to think).
The Summoning
The characters should summon the devil and use a protective circle to contain it.
{{ DEVIL_NAME }} is a minor devil. The hellplane from which she comes is bitterly cold and empty. She is driven by two goals, first to feed and second to gather enough souls to open a gate to allow her to physically escape from her plane of existance. She is a collector of souls. Souls are a form of life magic. When she has collected enough
Innocence
The devils first gambit will be to try and dupe the characters. The devil will appear as an attractive, buxom, semi-naked young woman (think Frank Frazetta illustraions). The devil will act surprised and disconcerted to be transported to this place. Saying things like: "Who are you?", "Where am I?", "How did I get here?", and "it's very Cold". The "girl" should initially project innocence and vulnerability. As the characters "calm her down" she will start to be suggestive, now projecting conscious, but subtle sensuality and suggestiveness. The role now is one of an attractive woman who knows she can often use her looks to get what she wants.
This is of course an act, The devil is trying to beguile the characters into letting her out. She speaks with a local accent. If the characters ask her what her name is she'll say {{ DEVIL_NAME_ALIAS }}. If they tell her name is {{ DEVIL_NAME }} she will explain to them slowly, as if they are simple, that her name is {{ DEVIL_NAME_ALIAS_SLOW }}. If they ask her about herself she'll say her parents have a farm, but she left to come to the city to make money, and she's working as a dancer. She'll ask if she can go home. If the characters offer to banish her she'll say "No, I don't want to go through that again". She'll ask if it's safe to leave the circle. If they say yes she will look at them disbelievingly. She's trying to get them to break the protective circle.
At some point the characters will break the circle, or the devil will give up on the charade and change to her next strategy.
